channel.title: Calling data from a source in a batch file
channel.description: How do i call data from somewhere else like another computer to a batch file. this is used in a few compilers ive seen but i never figured oout how it was done. i found a tutorial using good but i didn't understand it. so help?

item.title: Calling data from a source in a batch file
item.dc:creator: @Cryme_Time Cryme Time
item.description:
@Cryme_Time wrote:

On another topic

On my server source, it says “Starting port on +port+” when you run the server but this is not in the batch file. This is in the java file called server.java. If you want text to appear in the batch file first, you put echo before your message. cls clears all the echos that have appeared so far.

your fucking stupid, i don’t want your help thats not calling from another source.

Read full topic
item.source: Calling data from a source in a batch file

item.title: Calling data from a source in a batch file
item.dc:creator: @Cryme_Time Cryme Time
item.description:
@Cryme_Time wrote:

[quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:170880”][quote author=Cryme Time link=topic=230846.msg1976533#msg1976533 date=1199499660]
How do i call data from somewhere else like another computer to a batch file. this is used in a few compilers ive seen but i never figured oout how it was done. i found a tutorial using good but i didn’t understand it. so help?
[/quote]
If the program is on another computer on your network you would put something like this:

cd “\computername\SharedDocs\folder1”
call yourprogramhere.bat

cd sets the directory (call directory) to the computer on your network, and call is the program you want to run.

Is this what you were asking?[/quote]

Example: Silabs client <- when you run it it gets it’s after compile/run echo lines from a source. how does that work?

Read full topic
